abstract: It’s been almost two years since the collapse of Lehman Brothers, and so far no villain responsible for the financial crisis has emerged. That’s because there wasn’t one, people tell The New York Observer.
snippet: It’s been almost two years since the collapse of Lehman Brothers, and so far no villain responsible for the financial crisis has emerged. That’s because there wasn’t one, people tell The New York Observer.
lead_paragraph: It’s been almost two years since the collapse of Lehman Brothers, and so far no villain has emerged who can be brought to account.

headline.main: Why No Villains Have Emerged From the Crisis
